The long drawn-out process of brand creation absolutely has a place and is here to stay, but it‚Äôs not for all of us.

Logo in-a-week argues that constraint prevents sprawl and scope-creep and laser-focuses the decision-making process.

Meetings, revisions, and corralling everyone‚Äôs input can be arduous.

Take a breather and get it done quick.

Cost

This service follows the gift-economy model.

Meaning I‚Äôm prepared to give you this as a gift and you are welcome at the end of it to pay me, in money or other, or some other way.

I think this is important right now. Assigning a dollar amount to every thing in our lives slowly corrodes relationships. This is a pro-relationship business.

I‚Äôve used this model for many projects and I‚Äôm excited to expand it.

(check out where I wrote more about freelancing in the gift.)

Here‚Äôs how it works

  1. Kickoff

    We we align on your vision and needs at our one and only meeting.

  2. Draft

    I share 2-3 rough concepts with you. You pick one.

  3. Refine

    I go back to dial in your new logo. Repeat as many as we can fit.

  4. Deliver

    I email you the logo, colors, and fonts -- all you need for web and print.

FAQ

Why not 2 weeks?

I believe that working within constraints allows space for excellent work.

It forces you, the business owner, to make decisions and not waddle, waffle.

And it forces me, the designer, to also make decisions and crank out excellent designs.

Why you?

Experience. Dozens of folks have trusted me to create their branding and half a dozen have taken a jump into the gift-world with me.

Passion. Behind this idea is an urge to help small local orgs succeed.

I want to give that old pizza shop getting cornered by Chili‚Äôs and Texas Roadhouse a fighting chance.

I aim to help you expand your reach by creating a crunchy promise you can sink your teeth into, creating something recognizable, memorable, professional.

Quick reminder that logos are magic

They have the power to communicate your values, philosophy, reputation, and what customers can expect by using succinct imagery.

Your logo is the core of your brand.

Branding is the whole thing - the combination of messaging and visuals you consistently use.

With this service, it‚Äôs up to you to apply and express the logo in ways that resonate with your audience.

It‚Äôs also up to you to back up the promise of a logo with action.
